formalText: Call her Audrey.
She feels quite young and better than most women in their 20s.
Her ID would say she is 35 but she feels 23 and free.
She's come to see us in the emergency clinic today.
How it works is God tells her that she's real.
God tells her go on.
Yes, he talks to her.
She hears him in her ears.
That's what she's used to hearing and he talks to her with his mouth.
She calls him beardie.
Once he didn't like that.
So she just calls him sir.
He likes to be called Sir.
He tells her she's fantastic
and how great she is for doing this and getting stuck into this and keeping at it and that she should show it to people, so that's what she does.
She's sent copies of stuff to the pope right in the Archbishop of Canterbury and none of them have written back.
She hasn't had time to sleep now.
She doesn't need it.
She's got all this enthusiasm from God.
It's the energy inside her.
She feels as if she's got a lot of energy.
Tons of it tons of it.
She feels fantastic because God's telling her she's doing a really good job.
This has been going on for so long.
She had been low sometime when she was younger a long time ago.
She doesn't remember because that was long ago.
Her doctor put her on Prozac, but it didn't do anything though.
She doesn't need anything else.
She showed her sister Libby this and she told her to go get help and that she was bonkers.
In fact, she didn't say go away, and she told her to get the fuck away from her.
It's just her.
She hasn't had time to sleep now.
She doesn't need it.
She's physically fine.
